meta.title: Surgery Part-1 Test (The Champion Batch Hyderabad) - 13-06-2024 - 2024-06-13

questions.text: Which of the following is false about Zenker’s diverticulum?

options.label: A
options.text: Most patients are above 50 years of age

options.label: B
options.text: It is the most common esophageal diverticulum

options.label: C
options.text: Mucosal out pouching through the Killian’s dehiscence

options.label: D
options.text: Esophageal manometry is the investigation for diagnosis

questions.correct_answer: D. Esophageal manometry is the investigation for diagnosis

questions.text: A 30-year-old male patient presented with abdominal pain, fever, nausea, vomiting and respiratory distress. His BP was found to be 80/40 mm Hg and pulse rate of 115/min. The following chest X-ray was recorded in ER. What is the immediate management?

A young boy presented to the casualty with a history of fever, pain abdomen and vomiting. On examination, he was febrile with a pulse rate of 104 beats/min. What sign is the doctor trying to elicit below?
Heller’s operation is done for?
All of the following is true about achalasia cardia except:

options.label: A
options.text: Lower esophageal sphincter does not relax normally

options.label: C
options.text: Dysphagia is initially more to liquids

options.label: D
options.text: Manometry is the most confirmatory investigation

questions.text: Which of these is incorrect about highly selective vagotomy?

options.label: B
options.text: Crow’s feet supplying the pylorus are sacrificed

options.label: C
options.text: Recurrence rates are higher than truncal vagotomy

questions.correct_answer: B. Crow’s feet supplying the pylorus are sacrificed
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Crow’s feet supplying pylorus are sacrificed

questions.text: Pancreatic pseudocyst is developed in how much duration following an attack of acute pancreatitis?
Most common electrolyte imbalance that causes paralytic ileus is:
What is the initial treatment for a patient presenting with appendicular phlegmon in a CT Scan?
A 5-year-old child spills boiling water accidentally over her face and trunk. Which of the following methods is most correct to estimate the body surface area involved in burns?
Which of the following is not true about resuscitation in burn patients?

options.label: A
options.text: Ringers lactate is the preferred crystalloid solution

options.label: B
options.text: Fluid shift from intravascular to extravascular compartment in burns patient is maximum in the first 24 hours

options.label: C
options.text: Quantity of crystalloid needed is calculated using the parkland formula - 6 ml/kg body weight per % of the total body surface area burnt

questions.correct_answer: C. Quantity of crystalloid needed is calculated using the parkland formula - 6 ml/kg body weight per % of the total body surface area burnt
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Quantity of crystalloid needed is calculated using the parkland formula - 6 ml/kg body weight per % of the total body surface area burnt

questions.text: Blisters are seen in which type of burns?
All are advantages of split thickness skin grafting except?
A chronic smoker gets cramping pain in his right calf after walking about 500 m. What is the likely pathology?

A 55-year-old male presents with a lesion on his face as shown. Which of these statements is/are incorrect? Slow growing Affects fair-skinned individuals Histopathology shows keratin pearls Lymphatic metastasis is common
Fixing a strip of External Oblique Aponeurosis to re-inforce the inguinal canal is called:
A male child presented with non-bilious vomiting at 4 weeks of age. An X ray was taken that shows the following: What is false regarding the above condition?

options.label: A
options.text: If presented late, dehydration requiring resuscitation and weight loss predominate

options.label: B
options.text: Olive shaped palpable mass is best felt when the baby is crying

options.label: C
options.text: Peristalsis from left to right side of abdomen may be seen on feeding

questions.correct_answer: B. Olive shaped palpable mass is best felt when the baby is crying

questions.text: A 60-year-old man presents with a painless bulge in the groin that enlarges with standing and reduces when lying down. On examination, the bulge is located medially to the inferior epigastric vessels. Which of the following structures does NOT form the boundary of the area where this patient's hernia is located, known as Hesselbach's triangle?
All of the following are seen in MEN-I syndrome except:

A patient came with complaints of cramping pain in right lower limb which worsened on walking and was relieved by rest. He also had loss of hair, dry skin, brittle nails on right lower limb. What is your next step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Arterial Duplex ultrasound

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Duplex/ Doppler ultrasound is a non-invasive technique that combines B mode ultrasound and Doppler to obtain an image of vessels and details about direction and velocity of blood flow. In experienced hands, it is as accurate as angiography and is cost-effective and safe.

questions.text: True statement about use of compression stockings in varicose veins:

options.label: A
options.text: No benefit in preventing or progression of disease

options.label: B
options.text: Class I stockings are used in venous ulcer

options.label: C
options.text: Provide equal improvements in QoL and cost- effective compared to surgery

questions.correct_answer: A. No benefit in preventing or progression of disease
questions.explanation: Ans. A) No benefit in preventing or progression of disease

questions.text: A 45-year-old male patient underwent a routine USG following which this finding was noted. What is FALSE regarding the above condition?

options.label: C
options.text: PAIR is the treatment of choice in cysto-biliary communication

options.label: D
options.text: Echinococcus parasite is the causative agent

questions.correct_answer: C. PAIR is the treatment of choice in cysto-biliary communication
questions.explanation: Ans. C) PAIR is the treatment of choice in cysto-biliary communication.

questions.text: A 35-year-old male had visited India a couple of months back. He had a history of bloody diarrhea for a few days upon returning, which subsided on its own. He now presents with right upper abdominal pain, low-grade fever, and weight loss. On examination, the patient shows pallor and tender hepatomegaly. Imaging shows fluid collection in liver. What is incorrect about this disease?

options.label: B
options.text: The life cycle is partly in sheep and partly in man

options.label: C
options.text: The treatment of choice is metronidazole with chloroquine and diloxanide furoate

options.label: D
options.text: The aspirate shows “sterile pus” on microscopy

questions.correct_answer: B. The life cycle is partly in sheep and partly in man
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The life cycle is partly in sheep and partly in man.

questions.text: A 58-year-old male with a history of chronic alcohol consumption on routine check-up was found to have hepatomegaly. His LFT was essentially normal, Serum AFP was 490 ng/ml. CECT showed rapidly enhancing mass in the setting of nodularity. What is the likely diagnosis?
All are risk factors for the development of cholesterol gallstones except?

A 35-year male with a history of intermittent right upper abdominal pain presents to the clinician. His abdominal examination is normal. A USG abdomen reveals multiple tiny GB calculi. Liver profile shows direct bilirubin of 2.4 mg% and elevated alkaline phosphatase. What is the next step?

A patient underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy for cholelithiasis. Histopathology of the resected gall bladder is reported as Stage T1a of gallbladder cancer. What would be the next line of management?
What will be the treatment of choice in a choledochal cyst that has been classified by Todani as grade III?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Endoscopy sphincterotomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The management of choledochal cysts varies depending on the Todani classification of the cyst. For a Type III choledochal cyst, endoscopic sphincterotomy is the treatment of choice, aimed at relieving the obstruction at the level of the ampulla of Vater. It is essential for clinicians to correctly classify the type of choledochal cyst to determine the appropriate surgical intervention.
  • ➤ The management of choledochal cysts varies depending on the Todani classification of the cyst. For a Type III choledochal cyst, endoscopic sphincterotomy is the treatment of choice, aimed at relieving the obstruction at the level of the ampulla of Vater. It is essential for clinicians to correctly classify the type of choledochal cyst to determine the appropriate surgical intervention.

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient underwent a lap cholecystectomy for gallstones. On day 2 in the postoperative period, he experienced fever and pain in the right hypochondrium. Ultrasonography revealed 200cc of fluid in the GB fossa. What is your next step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Ultrasound-guided drainage

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ In a patient presenting with fever and right hypochondrial pain post-cholecystectomy, accompanied by fluid collection on ultrasound, the initial step should be ultrasound-guided drainage. This minimally invasive approach can effectively manage a bile leak, which is a recognized complication after gallbladder surgery. Further diagnostic and therapeutic measures, such as ERCP, MRCP, or surgical intervention, depend on the clinical evolution and findings after the initial drainage.

questions.text: A patient presented with acute pain in abdomen which radiated to the back and is relieved on sitting bent forwards. The following sign was seen on examination. Which sign is shown?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Cullen sign

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cullen sign, characterized by peri-umbilical bruising due to retroperitoneal bleeding, is a clinical feature associated with conditions like acute pancreatitis.

questions.text: Criteria for SIRS include all of the following except -
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) BP <90/60 mm Hg

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Systemic Inflammatory Response Syndrome is defined by the presence of two or more of the following criteria:
  • • Heart rate >90/min Core temperature <36°C or >38°C Respirations >20/min or PCO2 <32 mmHg White blood cell count <4000 or >12 000/mm3
  • • Heart rate >90/min
  • • Core temperature <36°C or >38°C
  • • Respirations >20/min or PCO2 <32 mmHg
  • • White blood cell count <4000 or >12 000/mm3

questions.text: A patient was diagnosed with chronic pancreatitis. What is the most common cause of this condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Alcohol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Alcohol consumption is the most common cause of chronic pancreatitis, especially in developed countries, due to its repeated damaging effects on the pancreatic tissue over time.

questions.text: Which of the following is not one of the common features of glucagonoma?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Diarrhea

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Glucagonoma syndrome is a rare syndrome, with a classic presentation of the “4 D’s’’: -
  • • Diabetes Dermatitis Deep vein thrombosis Depression
  • • Diabetes
  • • Dermatitis
  • • Deep vein thrombosis
  • • Depression

questions.text: TIPSS creates a shunt between which 2 veins?

options.label: B
options.text: Portal vein and internal jugular vein

questions.correct_answer: C. Portal vein and hepatic vein
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Portal vein and hepatic vein

questions.text: Which of these is the most common cause of portal hypertension worldwide?

A 58-year-old male who underwent a kidney transplant 7 years ago presents with gradually worsening renal function over the past year. He has no signs of infection, maintains good hydration, and reports compliance with his immunosuppressive medications. A renal biopsy reveals interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy without evidence of acute inflammatory changes. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's renal dysfunction?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Chronic rejection

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Chronic rejection is the most common cause of graft failure/dysfunction in kidney transplant, typically presenting as progressive organ dysfunction over time due to immunological factors.

questions.text: Which of these is the ideal donor for an organ transplant?

options.label: A
options.text: Brain dead donor who is an identical twin

options.label: B
options.text: Living donor who is an identical twin

options.label: C
options.text: Brain dead donor who has the same blood group

options.label: D
options.text: Living donor who has the same blood group

questions.correct_answer: B. Living donor who is an identical twin
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Living donor who is an identical twin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ The ideal organ donor is a living donor who is an identical twin of the recipient due to the perfect HLA match and the optimal condition of the donated organ, which significantly reduces the risk of rejection and improves transplant outcomes.
  • ➤ The ideal organ donor is a living donor who is an identical twin of the recipient due to the perfect HLA match and the optimal condition of the donated organ, which significantly reduces the risk of rejection and improves transplant outcomes.

questions.text: A 35-year-old female patient came to the physician with complaints of heartburn and regurgitation of food. The symptoms have been present for 3 years but have worsened for the past 3 months. She took over-the-counter medications but the symptoms did not subside. Upper GI endoscopy shows the following presentation. What is your probable diagnosis?
Which of these is correct about hiatus hernia?

options.label: A
options.text: Best seen on upper GI endoscopy

options.label: B
options.text: Mixed type involves upward migration of GE junction

options.label: C
options.text: Rolling type is commonly linked to GERD

questions.correct_answer: B. Mixed type involves upward migration of GE junction
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Mixed type involves upward migration of GE junction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Both sliding (type 1) and mixed (type 3) hiatus hernias are associated with migration of GE junction. CT with contrast is diagnostic, and surgery is required for larger or symptomatic hiatus hernias.

questions.text: The most common site for intestinal tuberculosis is?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Distal ileum

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Intestinal tuberculosis most commonly affects the ileocecal region and may present with a variety of symptoms including abdominal pain, weight loss, and fever. The disease can manifest in two forms, ulcerative and hyperplastic, with the ulcerative form often being secondary to pulmonary tuberculosis.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding FAP is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: Autosomal dominant condition due to mutation of the APC gene

options.label: B
options.text: More than 50 colonic adenomas are diagnostic

options.label: C
options.text: The lifetime risk of colorectal cancer is up to 100%

options.label: D
options.text: In a patient where the rectum is spared, total colectomy and ileorectal anastomosis can be considered as a treatment modality

questions.correct_answer: B. More than 50 colonic adenomas are diagnostic
questions.explanation: Ans. B) More than 50 colonic adenomas are diagnostic

questions.text: According to 8th AJCC classification of colorectal cancers, tumor deposits in the visceral peritoneum and serosal breach is staged as?

A 35-year-old female is brought to casualty with abdominal pain and diarrhoea. She is a known case of sigmoid diverticular disease. She undergoes laparotomy and is found to have fecal collection in the abdomen. What is her Hinchey stage?

A previously well 7-month-old male infant suddenly presents with episodes of screaming. The child appears pale and listless. The stools are red currant jelly-like. What is false regarding the above condition?

options.label: A
options.text: There is an associated feeling of hardness over the Right iliac fossa.

options.label: B
options.text: Dehydration may occur if left untreated

options.label: C
options.text: Hyperplasia of Peyer’s patches may be a trigger

options.label: D
options.text: The most common type in children is ileocolic

questions.correct_answer: A. There is an associated feeling of hardness over the Right iliac fossa.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) There is an associated feeling of hardness over the Right iliac fossa.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In intussusception, the feeling of hardness over the right iliac fossa is not a typical clinical sign; instead, an associated feeling of emptiness, known as Dance's sign, may be present.

questions.text: All of the following are true about paralytic ileus except?

options.label: B
options.text: Colicky pain is not a feature of this condition

options.label: C
options.text: Elective abdominal surgery is the main risk factor

questions.correct_answer: A. Bowel sounds will be hyperperistaltic
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Bowel sounds will be hyperperistaltic

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In paralytic ileus, bowel sounds are typically reduced or absent, not hyperperistaltic, due to impaired bowel motility.

questions.text: A 28-year-old male presents with colicky abdominal pain and bilious vomiting 3 years following an open appendectomy. Abdominal examination reveals hyper-peristalsis. X-ray abdomen showed the following. What is the likely pathology and the next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Paralytic ileus - Put a NG tube

questions.text: Which of these procedures for rectal prolapse is not via perineal approach?

A 45-year-old male presented with something coming out per anus (SCOPA) and splash in the pan type of blood in stools. On examination, the mass remains outside and has crossed the anal verge but can be manually reduced. Which is the grade of the disease?

A 30-year-old male presents with a 6-month history of perianal discomfort and purulent discharge. On physical examination, there is induration in the perianal region, suggestive of a chronic fistula-in-ano. What is the investigation of choice in this case?
Which type of hernia is depicted in the following diagram?
